title: The £17.5M mini-Buckingham palace-style house in Jersey with its own chapel
text:
It's been described as 'among the finest and most prestigious country estates in the Channel Islands' and this £17.5million house ticks plenty of status symbol boxes.

Among other aspects, the seven-bedroom property on the island of Jersey has two guest cottages and an estate manager's house, a wildlife lake, beautiful serpentine, its own chapel, a Japanese water garden and 58 acres.

And the main house itself commands attention, resembling a mini-Buckingham Palace, with its white exterior and large courtyard.

The impressive property is on the island of Jersey, the largest of the Channel Islands

The sense of grandeur and royalty begins at the property's approach. St John's Manor estate is for sale with Savills and in its advertising literature, the agent describes the property as 'among the finest and most prestigious country estates in the Channel Islands'.

The property caters for a variety of tastes, with stabling for keen horse riders, extensive garaging for a car fanatics and a walled area for gardeners.

Of course, no luxury home would be complete without a leisure suite - which in this case, includes not only a gym and an indoor swimming pool but a tennis court and a squash court.

‹ Slide me › The property in Jersey is for sale for £17.5million via estate agents Savills

The property is called St John's Manor Estate and it includes its own chapel in the grounds

The secluded Jersey manor house extends across almost 11,000 square feet

A piece of the Far East: There is also an attractive Japanese water garden

The main house is a stunning white colour and has an impressive driveway

The secluded manor house extends across almost 11,000 square feet and sits in 58 acres that includes agricultural land.

There are two guest cottages and an estate manager's house in the grounds.

The main house has seven bedrooms and six bathrooms.

Inside, there is a decorative interior that includes wood panelled walls

‹ Slide me › The entrance gate at St John's Manor Estate is similar to the one found at Kensington Palace

Rightmove's property expert Miles Shipside said: 'This country estate is beautifully extravagant, it's such a wonderful property.

'The décor is like something out of a Hollywood period drama; luxuriously elaborate and befitting of royalty.

'It's a genuine treat for Rightmove to showcase homes such as this and I'm sure the lucky buyers will create many happy memories here for years to come.'

St John's Manor Estate makes an impressive statement inside and out
